Introduced in cs10dotnet6, 

1) The compiler auto-generates a .cs file in the obj folder called:

{project name}.GlobalUsings.g.cs

It will be on folder obj/{release type}/{.net version}

* - to see the obj folder from Solution Explorer, click on the project, then "Show all files"

2) It would look like this:

// <auto-generated/>
global using global::System;
global using global::System.Collections.Generic;
global using global::System.IO;
global using global::System.Linq;
global using global::System.Net.Http;
global using global::System.Threading;
global using global::System.Threading.Tasks;

3) These are all automatically included for every .cs file.

4) To control which namespaces to include or not include:

	a) open the .csproj file
	b) on ItemGroup, add <Using Remove="{namespace}" /> or <Using Include="{namespace}" /> to remove or include namespaces.

	Example:

	<ItemGroup>
		<Using Remove="System.Threading" />
		<Using Include="System.Numerics" />
	</ItemGroup>


After adding these in the csproj file, the GlobalUsings.g.cs will now look like this:

// <auto-generated/>
global using global::System;
global using global::System.Collections.Generic;
global using global::System.IO;
global using global::System.Linq;
global using global::System.Net.Http;
global using global::System.Numerics;
global using global::System.Threading.Tasks;
